name: Winners-take-all
body:
### Winners take All

Open healthcare data hack, London 13-14 December 2014

P Reich, K Hoonio, T Nhung, D Jones

Financial issues relating to UK prescription data (for Aug 2013 to July 2014).

How does the value of prescriptions vary across the UK?

Started by looking at prices of [houses sold](http://publicdata.landregistry.gov.uk/market-trend-data/price-paid-data/a/pp-complete.csv).  Decided that this might not provide a good indicator of personal wealth.

The [2011 census](http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/rel/census/2011-census/index.html), [raw data](http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/rel/census/2011-census/population-and-household-estimates-for-wards-and-output-areas-in-england-and-wales/rft-table-php01-2011-MSOAs-and-LSOAs.zip), gives average personal income within an [MSOA](http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/guide-method/geography/beginner-s-guide/census/super-output-areas--soas-/index.html) (middle layer super output layers; used to aid the reporting of small area statistics, an area containing 5,000 to 15,000 people).

The prescription data included the postcode of the practice where it was written.  This was used to map practices to MSOAs using government [postcode data](https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/Docs/Lookups/Postcodes_(Enumeration)_(2011)_to_output_areas_(2011)_to_lower_layer_SOA_(2011)_to_middle_layer_SOA_(2011)_to_local_authority_districts_(2011)_E+W_lookup.zip).

[Per capita income](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Per_capita_income), the mean income per person within an economic unit.

Google map of [spending on prescriptions per capita](http://sandbox.hoonio.com/datahack/) for each MSOA.

Prescription costs per capita
